% Define support macros for attaching opening and closing lines to notebooks
\newsavebox\nbsphinxbox
\makeatletter
\newcommand{\nbsphinxstartnotebook}[1]{%
    \par
    % measure needed space
    \setbox\nbsphinxbox\vtop{{#1\par}}
    % reserve some space at bottom of page, else start new page
    \needspace{\dimexpr2.5\baselineskip+\ht\nbsphinxbox+\dp\nbsphinxbox}
    % mimick vertical spacing from \section command
      \addpenalty\@secpenalty
      \@tempskipa 3.5ex \@plus 1ex \@minus .2ex\relax
      \addvspace\@tempskipa
      {\Large\@tempskipa\baselineskip
             \advance\@tempskipa-\prevdepth
             \advance\@tempskipa-\ht\nbsphinxbox
             \ifdim\@tempskipa>\z@
               \vskip \@tempskipa
             \fi}
    \unvbox\nbsphinxbox
    % if notebook starts with a \section, prevent it from adding extra space
    \@nobreaktrue\everypar{\@nobreakfalse\everypar{}}%
    % compensate the parskip which will get inserted by next paragraph
    \nobreak\vskip-\parskip
    % do not break here
    \nobreak
}% end of \nbsphinxstartnotebook

\newcommand{\nbsphinxstopnotebook}[1]{%
    \par
    % measure needed space
    \setbox\nbsphinxbox\vbox{{#1\par}}
    \nobreak % it updates page totals
    \dimen@\pagegoal
    \advance\dimen@-\pagetotal \advance\dimen@-\pagedepth
    \advance\dimen@-\ht\nbsphinxbox \advance\dimen@-\dp\nbsphinxbox
    \ifdim\dimen@<\z@
      % little space left
      \unvbox\nbsphinxbox
      \kern-.8\baselineskip
      \nobreak\vskip\z@\@plus1fil
      \penalty100
      \vskip\z@\@plus-1fil
      \kern.8\baselineskip
    \else
      \unvbox\nbsphinxbox
    \fi
}% end of \nbsphinxstopnotebook

% Ensure height of an included graphics fits in nbsphinxfancyoutput frame
\newdimen\nbsphinx@image@maxheight % set in nbsphinxfancyoutput environment
\newcommand*{\nbsphinxincludegraphics}[2][]{%
    \gdef\spx@includegraphics@options{#1}%
    \setbox\spx@image@box\hbox{\includegraphics[#1,draft]{#2}}%
    \in@false
    \ifdim \wd\spx@image@box>\linewidth
      \g@addto@macro\spx@includegraphics@options{,width=\linewidth}%
      \in@true
    \fi
    % no rotation, no need to worry about depth
    \ifdim \ht\spx@image@box>\nbsphinx@image@maxheight
      \g@addto@macro\spx@includegraphics@options{,height=\nbsphinx@image@maxheight}%
      \in@true
    \fi
    \ifin@
      \g@addto@macro\spx@includegraphics@options{,keepaspectratio}%
    \fi
    \setbox\spx@image@box\box\voidb@x % clear memory
    \expandafter\includegraphics\expandafter[\spx@includegraphics@options]{#2}%
}% end of "\MakeFrame"-safe variant of \sphinxincludegraphics
\makeatother

\title{IXPE\sphinxhyphen{}tools}
\date{Jun 26, 2022}
\release{0.0.1}
\author{Youli Tuo}
\newcommand{\sphinxlogo}{\vbox{}}
\renewcommand{\releasename}{Release}
\makeindex
\begin{document}

\pagestyle{empty}
\sphinxmaketitle
\pagestyle{plain}
\sphinxtableofcontents
\pagestyle{normal}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{index::doc}}


\sphinxAtStartPar
A very useful toolbox for your IXPE data analysis.
This package is designed to handle IXPE polarization data and spectroscopy.
We provide tools to easily utilize Xspec and provide a package to display the results.

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{sphinx-tabs}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{closeable}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Installation

\sphinxAtStartPar
Navigation

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{sphinx-tabs-panel}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Download the whole repository to your local directory using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{git clone}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{git fetch}}.

\sphinxAtStartPar
For example, In you local path execute:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+go}{git clone https://github.com/tuoyl/IXPE\PYGZhy{}tools.git}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
And you will get the folder \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{IXPE\sphinxhyphen{}tools}}, in the folder you will see a file named \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{setup.py}}. We will install the whole package based on this script.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The most elegant thing to do before installing is to create a new conda environment to avoid conflicts with your existing python environment.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+go}{conda create \PYGZhy{}n ixpe\PYGZhy{}env python=3}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
after downloading the dependancies, execute

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+go}{conda activate ixpe\PYGZhy{}env}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
to enter the ixpe\sphinxhyphen{}env environment of conda, you will see (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ixpe\sphinxhyphen{}env}}) before the shell prompt.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Now you are all set to install the repository. In the directory where the setup.py located, execute:

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+go}{python3 \PYGZhy{}m pip install \PYGZhy{}e .}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
if you want to uninstall the package for generating the product.

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{g+go}{python3 \PYGZhy{}m pip uninstall ixpetools}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\end{sphinxuseclass}
\begin{sphinxuseclass}{sphinx-tabs-panel}
\end{sphinxuseclass}
\end{sphinxuseclass}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Three PHA file are loaded, An \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{XspecSpec}} object are created. Note that the background and response file are stored in the header of PHAs.

\sphinxAtStartPar
The parameter \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{show=True}} in method \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{XspecSpec.plot()}} present the Xspec plots in XWindow. You can also retrieve the data and make our own plots in Python. The retrieved \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{data}} are structured data object optimized for \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_stokes\_spectra}} method.

\begin{sphinxuseclass}{nbinput}

\label{\detokenize{notebooks/XspecSpectralAnalysis:MCMC-analysis}}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\section{IXPE\sphinxhyphen{}tools API}
\label{\detokenize{autodocs:ixpe-tools-api}}\label{\detokenize{autodocs::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Here follows the API documentation for the IXPE Tools.


\subsection{Xspec Anaysis}
\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/xspecanalysis:module-ixpetools.xspeclib.io}}\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/xspecanalysis:xspec-anaysis}}\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/xspecanalysis::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!ixpetools.xspeclib.io@\spxentry{ixpetools.xspeclib.io}}\index{ixpetools.xspeclib.io@\spxentry{ixpetools.xspeclib.io}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A module that wraps the Xspec tool, you need to pre\sphinxhyphen{}install HEASOFT Xspec
and initialize the HEADAS environment.

\sphinxAtStartPar
@author: Youli
\index{XspecSpec (class in ixpetools.xspeclib.io)@\spxentry{XspecSpec}\spxextra{class in ixpetools.xspeclib.io}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/xspecanalysis:ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{class }}\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{ixpetools.xspeclib.io.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{XspecSpec}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{spec\_files}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{background\_files}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{response\_files}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}{]}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
A spectrum class prepared for Xspec analysis
\index{fit() (ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec method)@\spxentry{fit()}\spxextra{ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/xspecanalysis:ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec.fit}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{fit}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{stat}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}chi2\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
perform the fitting procedure, the parameter
stat set the statistics to fit, default is ‘pgstat’
optional: \{pgstat | chi2 | cstat\}
return the covariance of the fitting results
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{stat} : str
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The statistic method to execute the fitting, optional
methods are \{‘pgstat’, ‘chi2’, ‘cstat’\}
\end{quote}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{flux() (ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec method)@\spxentry{flux()}\spxextra{ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/xspecanalysis:ixpetools.xspeclib.io.XspecSpec.flux}}\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{flux}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ngroups}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{energy\_low}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{energy\_high}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{cal\_error}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}}{}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate the (total) Model flux of specific group
of data
return the flux of specific compoent of model
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\item[{Parameters}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ngroups} : int
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
the number of the data group
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{energy\_low} : float
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
the lower energy limits to calculate the flux
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{energy\_high} : float
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
the upper limits of the energy range to calculate the flux
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{cal\_error} : bool (True for default)
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
whether to calculate the error of the flux (errsims option in Xspec)
\end{quote}

\item[{Returns}] \leavevmode
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{flux} : tuple
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The standard Xspec tuple of the results of flux.
the tutple contains 6 value (val errLow errHigh(in ergs/cm2) val errLow errHigh(in photons)).
Error values are .0 if flux was not run with errsims option.
\end{quote}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxstylestrong{A\_steps} : int
\begin{quote}

The steps for polarization degree. only works when steppar=True.
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{psi\_steps} : int
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The steps for polarization angle. Only works when steppar=True.
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{A\_range} : float
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The range to execute steppar. range is \([A-A\_\mathrm{range}, A+A\_\mathrm{range}]\), default is
determined by the 1sigma error of parameter A, that \(A\_\mathrm{range} = 5*\mathrm{\sigma_A}\)
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{psi\_range} : float
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
The range to execute steppar. range is \([\psi-\psi\_\mathrm{range}, \psi+\psi\_\mathrm{range}]\), default is
determined by the 1sigma error of parameter psi, that \(\psi\_\mathrm{range} = 5*\sigma_{\psi}\)
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{projection} : str
\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Projection to show the plots, \{None, ‘polar’\}
\end{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\begin{quote}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\end{quote}

\end{quote}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\subsection{Utilities}
\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/utilities:utilities}}\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/utilities::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Several useful utilities used throughout various modules


\subsubsection{Logger tool}
\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/utilities:module-ixpetools.utils.logger}}\label{\detokenize{APIdocs/utilities:logger-tool}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!ixpetools.utils.logger@\spxentry{ixpetools.utils.logger}}\index{ixpetools.utils.logger@\spxentry{ixpetools.utils.logger}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Global logger setup
Must be used by the whole application

\sphinxAtStartPar
The default format can be restored at any time with LoggerSetup.set\_default\_format()
The log level can be set at any time with LoggerSetup.set\_debug/info/warning/error\_level
The level is set at INFO by default

\sphinxAtStartPar
imported from pipeline\sphinxhyphen{}bricks
Created on 4 December 2019

\sphinxAtStartPar
@author: michel
\index{LoggerSetup (class in ixpetools.utils.logger)@\spxentry{LoggerSetup}\spxextra{class in ixpetools.utils.logger}}
